DataElement.preferredName: Hospitalized MI Medical Record Abstracted Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date of an instance of gross necrosis of the myocardium as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as abstracted from the hospital record.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hospitalized Myocardial Infarction Medical Record Abstracted Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Instance of gross necrosis of the myocardium as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as abstracted from the hospital record.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.:Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area. (Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.
Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints, the physician's physical findings, the results of diagnostic tests and procedures, and medications and therapeutic procedures. (dictionary.com):shortening or summarizing of documents.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints, the physician's physical findings, the results of diagnostic tests and procedures, and medications and therapeutic procedures.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.
